H0.text: Strong magnets can generate an electric current in a wire when the magnet is close enough to the wire.

H1.text: Weak magnets can generate an electric current in a wire when they are close enough to the wire and when the magnet is weak.

H2.text: At rest, a magnet can generate an electric current in a wire if the magnet is close enough to the wire.

H3.text: In motion, a magnet can generate an electric current in a wire if the magnet is close enough to the wire.

A4.text: the emf generated by Faraday's law of induction due to relative movement of a circuit and a magnetic field is the phenomenon underlying electrical generators

A5.text: the outcome was unaffected by which one was moving
